title: Fish Tacos with Cabbage and Salsa

instructions.1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
instructions.2: In a small bowl, mix salsa and mayonnaise; set aside.
instructions.3: In a Dutch oven or deep skillet, heat oil over medium high heat until it reaches 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). While the oil heats up, whisk beer, flour and salt in a medium bowl until smooth.
instructions.4: Using a fork, coat fish pieces in batter. Working in 2 batches, slide coated fish into hot oil. Fry until golden, about 4 minutes per batch. Lift out with a slotted spoon and drain briefly on paper towels; keep warm.
instructions.5: In a dry hot skillet, warm corn tortillas individually for 1-2 minutes per side. Stack on top of each other and keep warm in the oven.
instructions.6: To assemble, place 2 corn tortillas each on 4 individual plates. Put 1/2 cup of cabbage on each tortilla. Drizzle 2 tablespoons of the salsa mixture over each one. Evenly distribute fish pieces over the salsa and cabbage. Serve with lime wedges.

questions.question: In Step 5, is the oven from Step 1 being used?
Is oven from Step 1 used in multiple future steps without being redefined?
Is salsa from Step 2 used in multiple future steps without being redefined?
Is skillet from Step 3 still available in Step 4?
What is the last time interval specified in Step 5?
If we skip Step 2, is it still valid to use the salsa in Step 6?
Can we mix (Step 2) and use (Step 4) at the same time?
